source.705d3682: I added the feature 'BES' and 'GDP'. I got the data GDP from https://www.worldometers.info/gdp/.
source.071d4cd0: I tried to find which country is investing for R&D efficiently globally. Just my idea is that I may be able to find the country by considering the correlation between R&D investment and PCT. And I also tried to find which sector have huge influence to R&D, Industry, Government or Academia.

source.ac516f55:
First, I got the PCT data in 2020 from wipo website.( https://www.wipo.int/edocs/infogdocs/en/ipfactsandfigures/ ) PCT top 10 countries are China, the U.S., Japan, South Korea, Germany, France, the U.K., Swiss, Sweden and the Netherlands. In these countries, highest countries in R&D % in GDP in 2017 are South Korea 4.29%, Sweden 3.36%, Japan 3.20%, China 3.18%, Germany 3.05%, the U.S. 2.81%. And I also got the GDP amount data in 2017 and calculated the efficiency of R&D to PCT.

![image.png](attachment:a09354de-39f3-4a4d-a80a-be8a5e65f407.png)

![image.png](attachment:756680c8-7b1c-491e-9730-5896f16ebdb1.png)


Japan, South Korea and Sweden are higher than other countries in PCT/R&D. Next, I looked into the contribution of industry sector to total R&D (BES/TOTAL). Japan and South Korea are the highest in 10 countries, 79% and that of Sweden is 71%. These three countries have 6 companies out of PCT top 10 applicants, Mitsubishi Electronic, Sony, Panasonic, Samsung, LG and Ericsson.
source.96895d4d: I added the number of patent by PCT. I got the data from https://www3.wipo.int/ipstats/pmhindex.htm?tab=pct
source.a0d20225: I also found the data about human resource in OECD. South Korea, Denmark, Sweden and Finland are higher than other countries in 'Reseachers per thousand employment'. And Belguim, Austria, Germany, Japan and the U.S. are also high. It means that 9 countries out of top 10 R&D % in GDP are high 'Reseachers per thousand employment'
source.729f4bc5: US, China and Japan etc... have no data in 2019. And data in 2018 has also some NaN. So I used rhe data in 2017.
